page.title: 10MOLLESTON CHAPEL, TEMPLETON.
page.content: The Baptist Chapel at Molleston is the oldest chapel in Pembrokeshire. It is 254 years old, but the Baptist Movement in Molleston began in 1667. The people met in various places because of religious persecution at that time. Molleston Chapel was built in 1731 and rebuilt in 1884. There is a plaque in memory of Rev. T.L.Parry, who was the father of Lord Gordon Parry of Neyland. The cottage next to the chapel used to be the Manse until 1964.Rev.T.L.Parry lived there from 1923-1929. There have been 18 ministers. There are 8 deacons, 42 members and 25 life members. The oldest member is Mr Roach aged 94. A new organ was installed in 1984. There is a special service on the first Sunday in August every year.
